episodeTitle: Living through Hell! Sanji's Fight for His Manhood!
episodeTitleJapanese: 地獄を生き抜け サンジ男をかけた勝負
episodeTitleRomanized: Jigoku o Ikinuke - Sanji Otoko o Kaketa Shōbu
description: During the two-year separation, Nami convinces the Weatheria scholars to teach her advanced weather science, Franky discovers Dr. Vegapunk's hidden laboratory and commits to studying his blueprints, and Sanji accepts Ivankov's challenge to defeat the 99 masters of New Kama Kenpo to earn the recipes for Attack Cuisine.

events.title: Nami Tricks the Weatheria Scholars
events.description: After being caught trying to leave Weatheria, Nami tricks the elderly scholars by threatening to jump off the island, making them believe she would commit suicide. She uses this manipulation to convince them to let her stay and learn their weather science.
events.significance: Demonstrates Nami's cleverness and determination to become stronger for her crew. This moment sets up her two-year training period that will significantly enhance her abilities as the crew's navigator.

quotes.text: I need to learn everything about weather from you. Please teach me!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami begs Haredas to teach her about weather navigation after her manipulation succeeds

events.title: Nami Remembers Luffy's Support Against Arlong
events.description: Nami recalls the pivotal moment when Luffy helped her break free from Arlong's oppression, remembering how he encouraged her to ask for help and declared he would defeat Arlong for her.
events.significance: This flashback reinforces Nami's motivation to become stronger to support Luffy's dream, showing the deep bond and gratitude she feels toward her captain.

events.title: Haredas Agrees to Train Nami
events.description: After Nami explains her situation and her need to become stronger for her crew, Haredas agrees to teach her everything about weather science and the Weather Ball technology that Weatheria has developed.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of Nami's formal training in advanced weather manipulation, which will transform her from a talented navigator into a powerful combatant capable of wielding weather as a weapon.

events.title: Franky Discovers Vegapunk's Hidden Laboratory
events.description: After the explosion from pressing the self-destruct button, Franky discovers a second, hidden laboratory belonging to Dr. Vegapunk. This lab contains intact blueprints for weapons and Devil Fruit research that survived the explosion.
events.significance: This discovery provides Franky with access to the world's most advanced scientific knowledge, which will enable him to dramatically upgrade himself and the Thousand Sunny during the two-year timeskip.

quotes.text: This is... another lab! And all these blueprints... Vegapunk's research!
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky realizes he's found a treasure trove of scientific knowledge

events.title: Franky Commits to Studying Vegapunk's Blueprints
events.description: Franky tells Kitton, his grandfather, and Taroimo that he will be staying in the hidden laboratory to study Vegapunk's blueprints. He vows to get stronger and learn how to make the Thousand Sunny the ship of dreams.
events.significance: This decision sets Franky on the path to gaining the knowledge that will allow him to create revolutionary upgrades for himself and the crew's ship, including weapons inspired by Pacifista technology.

quotes.text: I'm going to get stronger! I'll make the Sunny into the ship of dreams!
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky declares his commitment to improving himself and the ship

events.title: Attack Cuisine Revealed
events.description: Emporio Ivankov explains Attack Cuisine to Sanji - a special type of cooking unique to the Kamabakka Kingdom that makes people's bodies stronger and their hearts purer. The cuisine consists of 99 recipes, each held by one of the 99 masters of New Kama Kenpo.
events.significance: Introduces a unique power-up system tied to cooking, perfectly suited to Sanji's role as the crew's chef. This knowledge will allow Sanji to enhance his crewmates' strength through food.

quotes.text: Attack Cuisine is a dish that makes peoples' bodies stronger and hearts purer!
quotes.speaker: Emporio Ivankov
quotes.context: Ivankov explains the special properties of Attack Cuisine to Sanji

events.title: Ivankov's Challenge: Defeat 99 Masters
events.description: Since Sanji refuses to become an okama, Ivankov offers an alternative: if Sanji can defeat all 99 masters of New Kama Kenpo while evading the island's inhabitants who will try to dress him as an okama, he will earn the right to learn all 99 Attack Cuisine recipes.
events.significance: Establishes the terms of Sanji's training, which will not only teach him powerful new combat techniques but also provide him with culinary knowledge to strengthen his crew through food.

events.title: Sanji Accepts the Challenge and Begins Training
events.description: After thinking about how Attack Cuisine could make his friends stronger through their daily meals, Sanji accepts Ivankov's challenge. He vows to get stronger for Luffy and begins his desperate fight against the 99 masters while avoiding being turned into an okama.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of Sanji's grueling two-year training that will teach him Sky Walk, enhanced combat abilities, and the Attack Cuisine recipes. His motivation is entirely focused on helping Luffy and the crew.

quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji commits to the training with thoughts of supporting his captain

quotes.text: I need to learn everything about weather from you. Please teach me!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami begs Haredas to train her in weather science

quotes.text: I'm going to get stronger! I'll make the Sunny into the ship of dreams!
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky's declaration after discovering Vegapunk's hidden laboratory

quotes.text: Attack Cuisine is a dish that makes peoples' bodies stronger and hearts purer!
quotes.speaker: Emporio Ivankov
quotes.context: Ivankov explains Attack Cuisine to Sanji

themes.description: All three featured Straw Hats commit to intensive training to become stronger. Each one is motivated by their desire to support Luffy and help him achieve his dream of becoming Pirate King.
themes.symbolism: The parallel structure of showing three crew members simultaneously beginning their training emphasizes the unity of purpose within the crew, even while separated.

themes.description: The episode emphasizes how the Straw Hats' bonds with Luffy and each other motivate them to endure harsh training. Nami's flashback to Arlong Park reinforces this theme.
themes.symbolism: Each character's training ground represents their personal hell, but their determination to reunite with Luffy gives them the strength to persevere.

themes.description: The episode showcases how acquiring knowledge (weather science, Vegapunk's technology, Attack Cuisine) can translate into power, fitting One Piece's broader theme that strength comes in many forms.
themes.symbolism: Franky's discovery of the hidden laboratory symbolizes that true power often lies in unexpected places and requires dedication to unlock.

characterSpotlights.development: Nami demonstrates her cunning and determination, using manipulation to secure her training. Her flashback to Luffy saving her from Arlong shows how far she's come and motivates her to become stronger.
keyActions: Tricks the Weatheria scholars with fake suicide threat
Convinces Haredas to teach her weather science
quotes: I need to learn everything about weather from you. Please teach me!

characterSpotlights.development: Franky shows his dedication to improving the crew's capabilities by committing to study Vegapunk's advanced technology despite the danger.
keyActions: Examines blueprints for weapons and Devil Fruit research
Vows to make the Thousand Sunny the ship of dreams
quotes: I'm going to get stronger! I'll make the Sunny into the ship of dreams!

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji learns about Attack Cuisine and accepts an incredibly difficult challenge, motivated entirely by his desire to help Luffy and make the crew stronger through his cooking.
keyActions: Learns about Attack Cuisine from Ivankov
Accepts challenge to defeat 99 New Kama Kenpo masters
Commits to avoiding being turned into an okama

characterSpotlights.development: Ivankov serves as Sanji's trainer and challenger, setting up the conditions for Sanji's growth during the timeskip.
keyActions: Sets the terms of the training
quotes: Attack Cuisine is a dish that makes peoples' bodies stronger and hearts purer!

characterSpotlights.development: Haredas agrees to train Nami in weather science after understanding her dedication to her crew.
keyActions: Initially tries to prevent Nami from staying
Agrees to teach Nami everything about weather

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends some of the scenes with additional dialogue and reaction shots not present in the manga chapters.
The episode covers non-consecutive pages from chapters 595 and 596, restructuring the content to focus on three specific Straw Hats in this episode.

trivia.fact: Episode 514 aired on September 11, 2011, in Japan and September 10, 2011, in the US (simulcast), marking one of the rare instances where the US broadcast preceded the Japanese broadcast due to time zone differences.
The episode was animated by Atsuko Kawamura, whose artwork received particular praise from fans for its quality in this episode.
This episode had a TV rating of 10.0% in Japan, ranking #3 for its time slot, showing strong viewership despite being part of the slower-paced Post-War Arc.
Attack Cuisine is unique to the Kamabakka Kingdom and represents one of the few explicit food-based power systems in One Piece, perfectly suited to Sanji's role as cook.

sources.title: Sanji/Abilities and Powers - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Weatheria was created 67 years before the main story by Haredas, who was from the destroyed sky island of Birka (the same island where Enel ruled).
The explosion Franky caused on Karakuri Island became known worldwide as 'The Nightmare of Baldimore' after he accidentally pressed the self-destruct button in the previous episode.
